info.title: RightScale Policy API
info.description:
[RightScale Policies](https://docs.rightscale.com/policies) allow you to automate governance across your multi-cloud environment to increase agility and efficiency while managing risk for your organization. The Policies API allows you to manage policies on a per-project basis. The API exposes four resources which are described below: PolicyTemplate, AppliedPolicy, Incident, and PublishedTemplate.

The API is available at the following endpoints:
* https://governance-3.rightscale.com/api/governance
* https://governance-4.rightscale.com/api/governance
* https://governance-10.rightscale.com/api/governance

Each project (aka account) exists at only one of the endpoints above.The HTTP response for requests made to an endpoint
that does not contain the corresponding project uses status code 302 and returns a "Location" header that contains the correct URL

Note that each resource in a policy template collection or a published template collection must have a unique name. The upload action on a policy template resource and
the create action on a published template resource returns conflict error when a resource with the given name already exists. The conflict response body indicates
whether the template can be overwritten with an update action.

The [OpenAPI specification](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md) (version 2)
for this API is available [here](http://reference.rightscale.com/governance-policies/governance/front_service/master/swagger.json).

## PolicyTemplate

The [PolicyTemplate](http://docs.rightscale.com/policies/#basic-concepts-policy-template-) resource is a policy definition
consisting of [policy template language](https://docs.rightscale.com/policies/reference/policy_template_language.html) source code.
The language is an infrastructure-as-code style language designed to make it easy to poll arbitrary cloud resources and
initiate actions based on the resulting data.

## AppliedPolicy

The [AppliedPolicy](http://docs.rightscale.com/policies/#basic-concepts-applied-policy) resource is a running policy
that has been created from a policy template. An applied policy runs continuously (per frequency) until deleted.
A single policy template can be used with various input parameters to create multiple applied policies.

## Incident

The [Incident](http://docs.rightscale.com/policies/#basic-concepts-incident) resource is created when a condition
of an applied policy is violated. If the policy validations all pass successfully then any associated existing incident is
automatically marked as resolved. An incident contains all of the information about the policy violation that triggered it
as well as the current handling status ('triggered', 'resolved', 'terminated).

## PublishedTemplate

The PublishedTemplate resource is a PolicyTemplate which has been made available across all projects in your organization.
These include both templates you've published as well as built-in RightScale templates.

## Auth

Requests made to the API must be authenticated using a token obtained from the [Cloud Management API](http://docs.rightscale.com/api/general_usage.html#authentication).
An "Api-Version" header must also be set; the current version is "1.0".

The API actions below list privileges (aka security scopes) required to access that particular action. Privileges are granted by
roles in the [user governance application](http://docs.rightscale.com/cm/ref/user_roles.html).

The following roles are unique to the Policies API. Except for policy_publisher, all roles can be granted for a single project or for an organization.
Privileges granted for a user at the organization level gives the permission to all projects within that organization.
* policy_publisher - able to publish/unpublish policy templates. This role can only be granted at an organization level.
* policy_viewer - able to view policy templates, applied policies, and incidents.
* policy_manager - able to create and delete applied policies; able to view all resources.
* policy_designer - able to upload/update and delete policy templates; able to create and delete applied policies; able to view all resources.

For more detailed information on roles, see [policy access control](http://docs.rightscale.com/policies/#access-control).

get.description:
Index retrieves the list of published templates in an organization.

Required security scopes:
  * `governance:published_template:index`

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: View used to render published templates

parameters.name: show_hidden
parameters.description: show_hidden will show templates that have been hidden if set to true.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: org_id identifies an organization by ID.

parameters.name: Api-Version
parameters.description: API Version, must be specified using this header

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: etag is an HTTP ETag. It is typically the previous ETag value retrieved by client if any. Service returns an empty response with HTTP status code 304 Not Modified if value matches current value server side.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: JWT token used to perform authorization

Update updates a published template in place for an organization, by replacing it. Any existing applied policies using the template will not be updated; they must be deleted and recreated again.

Required security scopes:

delete.description:
Delete deletes a published template from an organization. Deleting a published template will not delete any applied policies created from the template, they must be stopped explicitly.

Required security scopes:

description.description: description provides a human readable description for this specific application of the policy.
description.example: Delete unattached volumes after 24 hours in US-East.

dry_run.description: dry_run is a flag used for testing a policy so that an incident can be raised without performing an action.

frequency.description: frequency specifies the frequency with which to run policy evaluations

name.description: name provides a name for this specific application of the policy.

options.description: options lists the configuration options used to parameterize the policy.

template_href.description: template_href is the href of the policy template or published template that is applied.

example.description: Delete unattached volumes after 24 hours in US-East.
example.name: us_east_unattached_volumes

category.description: category is the type categorization of the applied policy.

created_at.description: created_at is the applied policy creation timestamp in RFC3339 format.

description.description: description provides a human readable description for this specific application of the policy.
description.example: Delete unattached volumes after 24 hours in US-East.

doc_link.description: doc_link is a HTTP URI to a page containing detailed documentation for the policy.

dry_run.description: dry_run is a flag used for testing a policy so that an incident can be raised without performing an action.

error.description: error is the error message returned if the evaluation failed. On success this attribute is empty.
error.example:
Message:
  val: invalid first argument: argument must be an object, got: array
Location:
  function "logic_or"
    argument #1
      function "eq"
        argument #1
          function "val"

errored_at.description: errored_at is the applied policy error timestamp in RFC3339 format. On success this attribute is empty.

frequency.description: frequency specifies the frequency with which to run policy evaluations

href.description: href is the href of the applied policy.

id.description: id identifies an applied policy by ID.

info.description: info is an arbitrary set of key/value pairs that provide additional information such as the policy author, support contact information, etc.

name.description: name provides a name for this specific application of the policy.

options.description: options lists the configuration options used to parameterize the policy.

severity.description: severity defines the severity level of incidents raised from this applied policy.

status.description: status is used to identify the current status of the applied policy.

updated_at.description: updated_at is the applied policy update timestamp in RFC3339 format.

doc_link.description: doc_link is a HTTP URI to a page containing detailed documentation for the policy.

dry_run.description: dry_run is a flag used for testing a policy so that an incident can be raised without performing an action.

error.description: error is the error message returned if the evaluation failed. On success this attribute is empty.
error.example:
Message:
  val: invalid first argument: argument must be an object, got: array
Location:
  function "logic_or"
    argument #1
      function "eq"
        argument #1
          function "val"

errored_at.description: errored_at is the applied policy error timestamp in RFC3339 format. On success this attribute is empty.

frequency.description: frequency specifies the frequency with which to run policy evaluations

href.description: href is the href of the applied policy.

id.description: id identifies an applied policy by ID.

info.description: info is an arbitrary set of key/value pairs that provide additional information such as the policy author, support contact information, etc.

name.description: name provides a name for this specific application of the policy.

options.description: options lists the configuration options used to parameterize the policy.

severity.description: severity defines the severity level of incidents raised from this applied policy.

status.description: status is used to identify the current status of the applied policy.

updated_at.description: updated_at is the applied policy update timestamp in RFC3339 format.

example.description: Delete unattached volumes after 24 hours in US-East.
example.error:
Message:
  val: invalid first argument: argument must be an object, got: array
Location:
  function "logic_or"
    argument #1
      function "eq"
        argument #1
          function "val"
example.name: us_east_unattached_volumes

evaluation_error.description: evaluation_error is the error message returned if the evaluation failed. On success this attribute is empty.
evaluation_error.example:

        argument #1
          function "val"

last_evaluation_finish.description: last_evaluation_finish is the timestamp of the finish of the last policy evaluation. It is omitted if the policy is currently evaluating.

last_evaluation_start.description: last_evaluation_start is the timestamp of the start of the last policy evaluation.

next_evaluation_start.description: next_evaluation_start is the timestamp of the next expected policy evaluation start. It is omitted if the policy is currently evalutating.

id.description: id is the ID of the incident, must be unique in the project.

options.description: options lists the configuration options used to parameterize the policy that created the incident.

resolution_message.description: resolution_message is an optional explaination of why the incident is resolved.

resolved_at.description: resolved_at is the incident resolution timestamp in RFC3339 format.

severity.description: severity defines the severity level of the incident.

state.description: state represents the current handling status of the incident.

summary.description: summary is a summary of the incident.

updated_at.description: updated_at is the incident update timestamp in RFC3339 format.

violation_data_count.description: The number of items in violation data.

IncidentResponseBody.description: Incident describes an incident raised from an applied policy. (default view)

IncidentResponseBodyCollection.title: Mediatype identifier: application/vnd.rightscale.incident; type=collection; view=default

action_failed.description: action_failed indicates whether any of the incident's actions failed during execution.

category.description: category is the type categorization of the incident.

created_at.description: created_at is the incident creation timestamp in RFC3339 format.

dry_run.description: dry_run is a flag used for testing a policy, that determines whether this incident should trigger escalation actions.

PublishedTemplateResponseBody.title: Mediatype identifier: application/vnd.rightscale.published_template; view=default

built_in.description: built_in is a flag to indicate whether the published template is a "built-in" RS-supplied template.

category.description: category is the type categorization of the published template.

created_at.description: created_at is the published template creation timestamp in RFC3339 format.

doc_link.description: doc_link is a HTTP URI to a page containing detailed documentation for the policy.

fingerprint.description: fingerprint is a SHA created during compilation. It is used to determine if the policy template that this was published from is outdated.

hidden.description: hidden is a flag to indicate whether the published template is hidden.

hidden_at.description: hidden_at is the hidden at timestamp in RFC3339 format.

href.description: href is the self-referential href of the published template.

id.description: id identifies a published template by ID.
id.example: Voluptates ut vel aspernatur commodi architecto assumenda.

info.description: info is an arbitrary set of key/value pairs that provide additional information such as the policy author, support contact information, etc.

name.description: name is the unique name of the published template in the organization.

org_id.description: org_id is the ID of the organization that the published template belongs to.

policy_template_fingerprint.description: policy_template_fingerprint is fingerprint of the policy template. It is used to determine if the policy template that this was published from is outdated.

policy_template_id.description: policy_template_id is the ID of the policy template from which the published template originated.

policy_template_url.description: policy_template_url is the full URL to the policy template from which the published template originated.

project_id.description: project_id is the ID of the project that the published template is published from.

required_roles.description: required_roles is a list of governance roles, derived from permissions, required to run the policy.

rs_pt_ver.description: rs_pt_ver is the policy engine version.

severity.description: severity defines the severity level of incidents raised from this published template.

short_description.description: short_description is the short description of the published template.
short_description.example: Checks for ports that are open in instances

updated_at.description: updated_at is the published template update timestamp in RFC3339 format.

error.description: error is any error occurred when handling the action.
error.example: failed to create cloud workflow process: definition foo not found

finished_at.description: finished_at is the time when the action was finished.

process_href.description: process_href is the href of a cloud workflow process. Required if the type is cloud_workflow.

started_at.description: started_at is the time when the action was started.

status.description: status is the status of the action.

type.description: type is the type of the action.

ResolutionActionResponseBody.description: ResolutionAction holds the status of a single action in a resolution.

GlobalSession.description:
Secures endpoint by requiring a valid JWT token retrieved via user credentials.
**Security Scopes**:
  * `governance:policy_template:compile`: Allows compiling policy templates
  * `governance:policy_template:upload`: Allows uploading policy templates
  * `governance:policy_template:update`: Allows updating policy templates
  * `governance:policy_template:delete`: Allows deleting policy templates
  * `governance:policy_template:show`: Allows showing policy templates
  * `governance:policy_template:index`: Allows indexing policy templates
  * `governance:published_template:create`: Allows creating published templates
  * `governance:published_template:update`: Allows updating published templates
  * `governance:published_template:hide`: Allows updating published templates
  * `governance:published_template:unhide`: Allows updating published templates
  * `governance:published_template:delete`: Allows updating published templates
  * `governance:published_template:show`: Allows showing published templates
  * `governance:published_template:index`: Allows indexing published templates
  * `governance:applied_policy:create`: Allows creating applied policies
  * `governance:applied_policy:delete`: Allows updating applied policies
  * `governance:applied_policy:show`: Allows showing applied policies
  * `governance:applied_policy:show_log`: Allows showing applied policy logs
  * `governance:applied_policy:index`: Allows indexing applied policies
  * `governance:applied_policy:evaluate`: Allows evaluating applied policies on demand
  * `governance:incident:resolve`: Allows resolving incidents
  * `governance:incident:show`: Allows showing incidents
  * `governance:incident:index`: Allows indexing incidents
  * `governance:approval_request:show`: Allows showing approval request
  * `governance:approval_request:index`: Allows indexing approval requests
  * `governance:approval_request:approve`: Allows approving an approval request
  * `governance:approval_request:deny`: Allows denying an approval request
GlobalSession.name: Authorization
